text: yet another tense standoff in the
suburbs of st. Louis after yet another
fatal shooting of another black teen
this time at a petrol station which
quickly became the focus for angry
exchanges between police and news the
police say the shocked teenager named
locally as Antonio Martin had raised a
gun at an officer conducting a routine
check but the team's mother says her son
was unarmed and trying to get away from
the police try to get up this latest
shooting happened just a couple of miles
from nearby Ferguson where another black
teen was fatally wounded by police in
August prompting weeks of rioting their
death and other fatal encounters have
led to demonstrations like this one in
New York on Tuesday demanding change and
a wider soul-searching across America
about the policing of minority
communities
the latest flashpoint and the suburbs of
st. Louis has seen looting and some
arrests and while eyewitnesses describe
the crowd as being small it's plain
tensions are high Rob Watson BBC news
